title: EIP-4844 Implementers' Call #9
body:
## Meeting Info
- [Dec 20, 2022, 15:30 UTC](https://savvytime.com/converter/utc-to-germany-berlin-united-kingdom-london-ny-new-york-city-ca-san-francisco-china-shanghai-japan-tokyo-australia-sydney/dec-20-2022/15-30)
    - **_Last call of 2022 - next call on Jan 3, 2023!_** 
- Duration: 60 minutes
- Recording: TBA
- Zoom: https://ethereumfoundation.zoom.us/j/84746360696?pwd=V1BrS0xGTTZubTgvbGlrcTdJQzdqZz09
- [Notes & action items](https://docs.google.com/document/d/15EatedrJanNxBZGPVASvwq9xgbTs5UxjsDfjpM6ppSY/edit?usp=sharing) 

ðŸ“†  Subscribe to the [Ethereum Protocol Call calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y191cGFvZm9uZzhtZ3JtcmtlZ243aWM3aGs1c0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t) for calendar invites

## Agenda
- Spec updates 
    - https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3169
    - https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/3113
       - PR: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3154
    - https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/3170
- [Devnet 3 updates](https://notes.ethereum.org/@timbeiko/4844-devnet-3)
- Large Block Spam Test  
- [Precompile benchmarking](https://github.com/ethereum/benchmarking/blob/master/shanghai/README.md)
- [Readiness checklist](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Breakout-Room/4844-readiness-checklist.md#testing)

I won't be able to make it this week due to traveling. Some updates on the Prysm side:

- Passing the latest spec test
- Tested local devnet withone1 prysm node andone1 geth with 256 validators:
    - https://hackmd.io/q1SLCaubTIWw_1zsEjW_Vg?view
    - https://github.com/flcl42/interop-4844-lite
- Tested prysm node can sync with local devnet through blocks and blobs by range. I also tested blocks and blobs gossip
- Tested blobs retrieval through p2p
- Tested blobs retrieval through RPC
- Tested blobs submission through geth and the blobs are correctly reflected with the prysm node
- The only thing I haven't tested is block and blob by root but I don't think that's blocking devnet3

Prysm is fully ready for devnet3. Will need the configs and a genesis time
